articles.author: Alexander Cornwell, Parisa Hafezi, Steve Holland
articles.description: Iran and Israel targeted each other with airstrikes early on Saturday after Israel launched its biggest-ever offensive against its longtime foe in a bid to prevent it from developing a nuclear weapon.
articles.title: Israel, Iran launch more barrages as Israel aims to wipe out Tehran's nuclear program

articles.author: Brad Brooks
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump can keep his deployment of National Guard troops in Los Angeles, according to a court ruling, as protests against immigration raids look set to enter their second week in the strongest backlash since his return to power in January.
articles.title: Trump allowed to keep National Guard in Los Angeles as more protests planned

articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Michael Martina, Matt Spetalnick
articles.description: If Israel succeeds, there is no guarantee the successor would not be even more hardline.
articles.title: Israel's attacks on Iran hint at a bigger goal: regime change

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran said on Friday the dialogue with the U.S. over Tehran's nuclear programme is "meaningless" after Israel's biggest-ever military strike against its longstanding enemy, accusing Washington of supporting the attack.
articles.title: Iran says nuclear talks with US 'meaningless' after Israel attack

articles.author: Sudipto Ganguly, Abhijith Ganapavaram, Sumit Khanna
articles.description: Rescue workers searched for missing people and aircraft parts on Friday after an Air India plane crashed onto a medical college hostel in the city of Ahmedabad, killing more than 240 people in the world's worst aviation disaster in a decade.
articles.title: Rescuers search for missing people, aircraft parts after Air India crash kills over 240

articles.author: Alexandra Alper
articles.description: U.S President Donald Trump formally approved Nippon Steel's fraught $14.9 billion bid for U.S. Steel on Friday, capping a tumultuous 18-month effort by the companies, beset by union opposition and two national security reviews.
articles.title: Trump gives formal blessing to Nippon Steel's $14.9 billion bid for US Steel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's administration has told immigration officials to largely pause raids and arrests in the agricultural industry, hotels and restaurants, the New York Times reported on Friday.
articles.title: US immigration officials told to largely pause raids on farms, hotels, NYT reports

articles.author: Marisa Taylor, Joey Roulette
articles.description: The the administration ordered the agencies to scrutinize Musk’s contracts to ready possible retaliation against the businessman and his companies, sources said.
articles.title: Exclusive: White House reviews SpaceX contracts as Trump-Musk feud simmers, sources say

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: Ye made a surprise appearance at Sean Diddy Combs' criminal trial on Friday, expressing support for his fellow rapper as he defends against sex trafficking charges.
articles.title: Ye makes surprise appearance at Sean 'Diddy' Combs trial; judge considers removing juror

articles.author: Omar Younis, Arafat Barbakh, Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali
articles.description: Reuters images showed Marines apprehending a civilian, restraining his hands with zip ties and then handing him over to civilians from the Department of Homeland Security.
articles.title: Exclusive: US Marines carry out first known detention of civilian in Los Angeles, video shows
